appsgate.lig.clock.sensor.impl
Class ConfigurableClockImpl

java.lang.Object
  appsgate.lig.clock.sensor.impl.ConfigurableClockImpl
All Implemented Interfaces:
CoreClockSpec, CoreObjectSpec
Direct Known Subclasses:
SwingClockImpl
public class ConfigurableClockImpl
extends java.lang.Object
implements CoreClockSpec, CoreObjectSpec

This java interface is an ApAM specification shared by all ApAM AppsGate application to provide current Time and Date information

Field Summary
(package private)  long alarmLagTolerance
          In case we miss an alarm because of delay took for processing, we allow to fire alarms that that should have occurred until 50 ms before current time
(package private)  java.util.Map<java.lang.Integer,java.lang.Long> alarmPeriods
          A map between the periods in millis of periodic alarms, matches the same alarm id as an alarm registered at current time

(package private)  java.util.Set<java.lang.Integer> disarmedAlarms
          As single time alarms are removed from the list they do not fire events two times But periodic events aren't removed, so we need to disarm them

goAlongUntil

public void goAlongUntil(long millis)
Description copied from interface: CoreClockSpec
Sets a date in the future, events between old time and the new one (currentTime + millis) WILL be thrown.

Specified by:
goAlongUntil in interface CoreClockSpec
Parameters:
millis - the amount of millis to add to current time (3600 0000 is one hour later)

registerAlarm

public int registerAlarm(java.util.Calendar calendar,
                         AlarmEventObserver observer)
Description copied from interface: CoreClockSpec
register a new single Alarm at specified calendar date

Specified by:
registerAlarm in interface CoreClockSpec
Parameters:
calendar - The date when clock event must be generated
observer - The observer that must be called
Returns:
An unique identifier for the Alarm (allow unregister and distinction between multiple alarm for a single observer) or -1 if registration impossible

unregisterAlarm

public void unregisterAlarm(int alarmEventId)
Description copied from interface: CoreClockSpec
Unregister a previously alarm setted

Specified by:
unregisterAlarm in interface CoreClockSpec
Parameters:
alarmEventId - the Id that has been generated on alarm registration

setTimeFlowRate

public double setTimeFlowRate(double rate)
Description copied from interface: CoreClockSpec
Sets the time flow rate (to speed-up or slow down time events)

Specified by:
setTimeFlowRate in interface CoreClockSpec
Parameters:
rate - Default is "1" (real time), if inferior to "1", simulated time will flow slower (0,5 means that a day will be done in 48 hrs), if superior to "1", simulated time will flow faster (2 means than a day will be done in 12 hrs) if less or equal to "0", value is invalid and will not be taken into account
Returns:
the setted time flow (best effort: might be different from the desired value, depends on the implementation and the hardware possibilities)

registerPeriodicAlarm

public int registerPeriodicAlarm(java.util.Calendar calendar,
                                 long millis,
                                 AlarmEventObserver observer)
Description copied from interface: CoreClockSpec
register a periodic Alarm that will occurs every specified period (each hour, each day, ...), starting from Calendar date

Specified by:
registerPeriodicAlarm in interface CoreClockSpec
Parameters:
calendar - Starting date for the alarms (first event will be triggered at Calendar + millis), if null registration start from now (current time of the clock)
millis - The period between each alarm
observer - The observer that must be called
Returns:
An unique identifier for the Alarm (allow unregister and distinction between multiple alarm for a single observer) or -1 if registration impossible
